schema.name: App Mention Subscription
schema.description: Subscribes to @mentions of this Slack app in any channel it's a member of.

default.name: On App Mention
default.description: Emitted when the app is mentioned. Contains the Slack app_mention event payload.

type.description: Payload of a Slack 'app_mention' event. See https://api.slack.com/events/app_mention for more details.

app_id.description: The ID of the application that is being mentioned (i.e., this app).

blocks.description: An array of Slack Block Kit layout blocks. Present if the message was composed using Block Kit or if Slack converted the text to a rich_text block. See Slack documentation for block structures.

items.description: A Slack Block Kit layout block object. Its structure is defined by Slack. For detailed structure, refer to: https://api.slack.com/reference/block-kit/blocks

bot_id.description: Optional. The bot ID, if the message that caused the mention was posted by a bot user. Not typically present for app_mention events triggered by human users mentioning the app.

channel.description: ID of a Slack channel (e.g., C0123ABC), private group (G0123ABC), or direct message (D0123ABC).

channel_type.description: Indicates the type of channel: 'channel' (public), 'group' (private), 'im' (direct message), 'mpim' (multi-person direct message).

client_msg_id.description: A unique identifier for the message, sent by the client. Only present for user-posted messages that trigger the mention.

event_ts.description: The timestamp of when an event was dispatched by Slack. It's often very close to the message's own 'ts'.

parent_user_id.description: Optional. The user ID of the author of the parent message, if this message is a reply in a thread.

team.description: ID of a Slack workspace (team) (e.g., T0123ABC).

text.description: The textual content of the message. Markdown is supported by default in many contexts.

thread_ts.description: Optional. The timestamp of the parent message, if this message is part of a thread. If this message starts a new thread by replying to an existing message, this field will be present. If it's a brand new message not in a thread, this field is usually absent unless it becomes the parent of a new thread, in which case `thread_ts` would equal `ts`.

ts.description: Timestamp of the message. This value is effectively the ID of the message in Slack's API and is used to reference it in other operations (e.g., updating, deleting, threading).

type.description: The specific type of event. For this block, it will always be 'app_mention'.

user.description: ID of a Slack user (e.g., U0123ABC).

schema.name: Send Text Message
schema.description: Sends a simple markdown-formatted text message to a Slack channel or user. Can optionally be a thread reply.

default.name: Send
default.description: Trigger sending the message.

channelId.name: Channel or User ID
channelId.description: ID of the channel (e.g., C0123ABC), DM (D0123ABC), or user (U0123ABC) to send the message to.

text.name: Message Text
text.description: The text of the message. Markdown is supported by default.

threadTs.name: Thread Timestamp
threadTs.description: If replying to a message, provide the 'ts' (timestamp) of the parent message.

default.name: Message Sent
default.description: Emitted when the message has been successfully sent.

channel.description: ID of a Slack channel (e.g., C0123ABC), private group (G0123ABC), or direct message (D0123ABC).

message.description: The complete message object as returned by Slack's chat.postMessage API. Contains details about the message that was posted.

app_id.description: ID of a Slack App (e.g., A0123ABC).

blocks.description: An array of Slack Block Kit layout blocks. Present if the message was composed using Block Kit or if Slack converted the text to a rich_text block. See Slack documentation for block structures.

items.description: A Slack Block Kit layout block object. Its structure is defined by Slack. For detailed structure, refer to: https://api.slack.com/reference/block-kit/blocks

bot_id.description: ID of a bot user (e.g., B0123ABC).

bot_profile.description: Profile information for the bot user that posted the message.

app_id.description: The App ID associated with this bot (same as the outer app_id if present).

deleted.description: Indicates if the bot user is deleted.

icons.description: URLs for the bot's avatar images.

id.description: Bot ID (same as the outer bot_id if present).

team_id.description: The Team ID (workspace ID) this bot belongs to (same as the outer team if present).

updated.description: Timestamp (Unix epoch) of the last profile update.

parent_user_id.description: Optional. The user ID of the author of the parent message, if this message is a reply in a thread.

subtype.description: Optional. Indicates a subtype of message, e.g., 'bot_message'. For messages sent by this block, it's often 'bot_message'.

team.description: ID of a Slack workspace (team) (e.g., T0123ABC).

text.description: The textual content of the message. Markdown is supported by default in many contexts.

thread_ts.description: Optional. The timestamp of the parent message, if this message is part of a thread. If this message starts a new thread by replying to an existing message, this field will be present. If it's a brand new message not in a thread, this field is usually absent unless it becomes the parent of a new thread, in which case `thread_ts` would equal `ts`.

ts.description: Timestamp of the message. This value is effectively the ID of the message in Slack's API and is used to reference it in other operations (e.g., updating, deleting, threading).

type.description: The type of the object, always 'message'.

user.description: The user ID of the sender. For messages sent by a bot token, this is the bot's user ID.

ts.description: Timestamp of the message. This value is effectively the ID of the message in Slack's API and is used to reference it in other operations (e.g., updating, deleting, threading).

schema.name: Create Channel
schema.description: Creates a new Slack channel (public or private).

default.name: Create
default.description: Trigger creating a new channel.

isPrivate.name: Private Channel
isPrivate.description: If true, creates a private channel. If false, creates a public channel.

name.name: Channel Name
name.description: Name of the channel to create. Must be lowercase, without spaces or periods, and shorter than 22 characters.

default.name: Channel Created
default.description: Emitted when the channel has been successfully created.

channel.description: The created channel object.

created.description: Unix timestamp when the channel was created.

creator.description: ID of a Slack user (e.g., U0123ABC).

id.description: ID of a Slack channel (e.g., C0123ABC), private group (G0123ABC), or direct message (D0123ABC).

is_channel.description: True if this is a public channel.

is_group.description: True if this is a private channel.

is_private.description: True if this is a private channel.

name.description: The name of the created channel.

schema.name: Variables
schema.description: A block that creates signals from a variables configuration object.

variables.name: Variables
variables.description: A JSON object where each field will become a signal with the field's value.

type.description: An object containing key-value pairs that will be converted to signals

schema.name: Invite Users to Channel
schema.description: Invites users to a Slack channel.

default.name: Invite
default.description: Trigger inviting users to the specified channel.

channelId.name: Channel ID
channelId.description: ID of the channel (e.g., C0123ABC) to invite users to.

users.name: User IDs
users.description: Array of user IDs (e.g., ["U0123ABC", "U0456DEF"]) to invite to the channel.

default.name: Users Invited
default.description: Emitted when users have been successfully invited to the channel.

channel.description: The channel object.

id.description: ID of a Slack channel (e.g., C0123ABC), private group (G0123ABC), or direct message (D0123ABC).

users.description: Array of user IDs that were invited.

schema.name: Kick Users from Channel
schema.description: Removes users from a Slack channel.

default.name: Kick
default.description: Trigger removing users from the specified channel.

channelId.name: Channel ID
channelId.description: ID of the channel (e.g., C0123ABC) to remove users from.

user.name: User ID
user.description: User ID (e.g., U0123ABC) to remove from the channel.

default.name: User Removed
default.description: Emitted when the user has been successfully removed from the channel.

channel.description: ID of a Slack channel (e.g., C0123ABC), private group (G0123ABC), or direct message (D0123ABC).

user.description: ID of a Slack user (e.g., U0123ABC).

schema.name: Invite Users to Channel
schema.description: Invites users to a Slack channel.

default.name: Invite
default.description: Trigger inviting users to the specified channel.

channelId.name: Channel ID
channelId.description: ID of the channel (e.g., C0123ABC) to invite users to.

users.name: User IDs
users.description: Array of user IDs (e.g., ["U0123ABC", "U0456DEF"]) to invite to the channel.

default.name: Users Invited
default.description: Emitted when users have been successfully invited to the channel.

channel.description: The channel object.

id.description: ID of a Slack channel (e.g., C0123ABC), private group (G0123ABC), or direct message (D0123ABC).

users.description: Array of user IDs that were invited.

schema.name: Get Channel Info
schema.description: Gets information about a Slack channel.

default.name: Get
default.description: Trigger getting information about the specified channel.

channelId.name: Channel ID
channelId.description: ID of the channel (e.g., C0123ABC) to get information about.

default.name: Channel Info Retrieved
default.description: Emitted when channel information has been successfully retrieved.

channel.description: The channel object with detailed information.

created.description: Unix timestamp when the channel was created.

creator.description: ID of a Slack user (e.g., U0123ABC).

id.description: ID of a Slack channel (e.g., C0123ABC), private group (G0123ABC), or direct message (D0123ABC).

is_archived.description: True if the channel is archived.

is_channel.description: True if this is a public channel.

is_general.description: True if this is the general channel.

is_group.description: True if this is a private channel.

is_im.description: True if this is a direct message.

is_private.description: True if this is a private channel.

num_members.description: Number of members in the channel.

creator.description: ID of a Slack user (e.g., U0123ABC).

last_set.description: Unix timestamp when purpose was last set.

creator.description: ID of a Slack user (e.g., U0123ABC).

last_set.description: Unix timestamp when topic was last set.

schema.name: Set Channel Purpose
schema.description: Sets the purpose for a Slack channel.

default.name: Set
default.description: Trigger setting the purpose for the specified channel.

channelId.name: Channel ID
channelId.description: ID of the channel (e.g., C0123ABC) to set the purpose for.

purpose.name: Purpose
purpose.description: The new purpose for the channel.

default.name: Purpose Set
default.description: Emitted when the channel purpose has been successfully set.

channel.description: ID of a Slack channel (e.g., C0123ABC), private group (G0123ABC), or direct message (D0123ABC).

purpose.description: The purpose that was set for the channel.

schema.name: Set Channel Topic
schema.description: Sets the topic for a Slack channel.

default.name: Set
default.description: Trigger setting the topic for the specified channel.

channelId.name: Channel ID
channelId.description: ID of the channel (e.g., C0123ABC) to set the topic for.

topic.name: Topic
topic.description: The new topic for the channel.

default.name: Topic Set
default.description: Emitted when the channel topic has been successfully set.

channel.description: ID of a Slack channel (e.g., C0123ABC), private group (G0123ABC), or direct message (D0123ABC).

topic.description: The topic that was set for the channel.

schema.name: Archive Channel
schema.description: Archives a Slack channel.

default.name: Archive
default.description: Trigger archiving the specified channel.

channelId.name: Channel ID
channelId.description: ID of the channel (e.g., C0123ABC) to archive.

default.name: Channel Archived
default.description: Emitted when the channel has been successfully archived.

channel.description: ID of a Slack channel (e.g., C0123ABC), private group (G0123ABC), or direct message (D0123ABC).

schema.name: Unarchive Channel
schema.description: Unarchives a Slack channel.

default.name: Unarchive
default.description: Trigger unarchiving the specified channel.

channelId.name: Channel ID
channelId.description: ID of the channel (e.g., C0123ABC) to unarchive.

default.name: Channel Unarchived
default.description: Emitted when the channel has been successfully unarchived.

channel.description: ID of a Slack channel (e.g., C0123ABC), private group (G0123ABC), or direct message (D0123ABC).

schema.name: Archive Channel
schema.description: Archives a Slack channel.

default.name: Archive
default.description: Trigger archiving the specified channel.

channelId.name: Channel ID
channelId.description: ID of the channel (e.g., C0123ABC) to archive.

default.name: Channel Archived
default.description: Emitted when the channel has been successfully archived.

channel.description: ID of a Slack channel (e.g., C0123ABC), private group (G0123ABC), or direct message (D0123ABC).

nameComponent.name: Unarchive Channel
nameComponent.description: When all users are removed (via the kick action) the channel is automatically archived, so we need to undo that

schema.name: Unarchive Channel
schema.description: Unarchives a Slack channel.

default.name: Unarchive
default.description: Trigger unarchiving the specified channel.

channelId.name: Channel ID
channelId.description: ID of the channel (e.g., C0123ABC) to unarchive.

default.name: Channel Unarchived
default.description: Emitted when the channel has been successfully unarchived.

channel.description: ID of a Slack channel (e.g., C0123ABC), private group (G0123ABC), or direct message (D0123ABC).

schema.name: Messages Subscription
schema.description: Subscribes to messages in Slack channels, optionally filtered by specific channel.

channelId.name: Channel ID (Optional)
channelId.description: If specified, only messages from this channel will be received. Leave empty to receive messages from all channels the app has access to.

default.name: On Message
default.description: Emitted when a message is posted. Contains the Slack message event payload.

type.description: Payload of a Slack 'message' event. See https://api.slack.com/events/message for more details.

app_id.description: Optional. The ID of the application that posted the message, if posted by a bot/app.

blocks.description: An array of Slack Block Kit layout blocks. Present if the message was composed using Block Kit or if Slack converted the text to a rich_text block. See Slack documentation for block structures.

items.description: A Slack Block Kit layout block object. Its structure is defined by Slack. For detailed structure, refer to: https://api.slack.com/reference/block-kit/blocks

bot_id.description: Optional. The bot ID, if the message was posted by a bot user.

channel.description: ID of a Slack channel (e.g., C0123ABC), private group (G0123ABC), or direct message (D0123ABC).

channel_type.description: Indicates the type of channel: 'channel' (public), 'group' (private), 'im' (direct message), 'mpim' (multi-person direct message).

client_msg_id.description: A unique identifier for the message, sent by the client. Only present for user-posted messages.

event_ts.description: The timestamp of when an event was dispatched by Slack. It's often very close to the message's own 'ts'.

parent_user_id.description: Optional. The user ID of the author of the parent message, if this message is a reply in a thread.

subtype.description: Optional. Indicates a subtype of message, e.g., 'bot_message', 'channel_join', etc.

team.description: ID of a Slack workspace (team) (e.g., T0123ABC).

text.description: The textual content of the message. Markdown is supported by default in many contexts.

thread_ts.description: Optional. The timestamp of the parent message, if this message is part of a thread. If this message starts a new thread by replying to an existing message, this field will be present. If it's a brand new message not in a thread, this field is usually absent unless it becomes the parent of a new thread, in which case `thread_ts` would equal `ts`.

ts.description: Timestamp of the message. This value is effectively the ID of the message in Slack's API and is used to reference it in other operations (e.g., updating, deleting, threading).

type.description: The specific type of event. For this block, it will always be 'message'.

user.description: ID of a Slack user (e.g., U0123ABC).

schema.description: Captures the last event received and makes it available as an exported key value

defaultValue.name: Default value
defaultValue.description: Default value to use when no event has been captured yet

schema.name: Add Reaction
schema.description: Adds a reaction (emoji) to a specific message in a Slack channel.

default.name: Add
default.description: Trigger adding a reaction to the specified message.

channelId.name: Channel ID
channelId.description: ID of the channel (e.g., C0123ABC) containing the message.

name.name: Reaction Name
name.description: The emoji name to add as a reaction (without colons, e.g., 'thumbsup', 'heart').

ts.name: Message Timestamp
ts.description: The timestamp (ts) of the message to add a reaction to.

default.name: Reaction Added
default.description: Emitted when the reaction has been successfully added.

channel.description: ID of a Slack channel (e.g., C0123ABC), private group (G0123ABC), or direct message (D0123ABC).

reaction.description: The emoji name that was added as a reaction.

ts.description: Timestamp of the message. This value is effectively the ID of the message in Slack's API and is used to reference it in other operations (e.g., updating, deleting, threading).

schema.name: Reactions Subscription
schema.description: Subscribes to reaction add and remove events on Slack messages.

default.name: On Reaction
default.description: Emitted when a reaction is added or removed. Contains the Slack reaction event payload.

type.description: Payload of a Slack 'reaction_added' or 'reaction_removed' event. See https://api.slack.com/events/reaction_added and https://api.slack.com/events/reaction_removed for more details.

event_ts.description: The timestamp of when an event was dispatched by Slack. It's often very close to the message's own 'ts'.

item.description: Information about the item that was reacted to.

channel.description: ID of a Slack channel (e.g., C0123ABC), private group (G0123ABC), or direct message (D0123ABC).

ts.description: Timestamp of the message. This value is effectively the ID of the message in Slack's API and is used to reference it in other operations (e.g., updating, deleting, threading).

type.description: The type of item (typically 'message').

item_user.description: The user ID of the author of the message that was reacted to.

reaction.description: The emoji name of the reaction (without colons, e.g., 'thumbsup').

team.description: ID of a Slack workspace (team) (e.g., T0123ABC).

type.description: The specific type of event. Will be either 'reaction_added' or 'reaction_removed'.

user.description: ID of a Slack user (e.g., U0123ABC).

schema.name: Auth Metadata
schema.description: Gets authentication metadata for the configured bot token, including team and user information.

bot_id.name: Bot ID
bot_id.description: The bot ID (only present for bot tokens).

user.name: User Name
user.description: The authenticated user's name (typically 'bot' for bot tokens).

nameComponent.name: Reaction Response Message
nameComponent.description: Sends a message to the same channel where a reaction was added, acknowledging the reaction with its name.

schema.name: Send Text Message
schema.description: Sends a simple markdown-formatted text message to a Slack channel or user. Can optionally be a thread reply.

channelId.name: Channel or User ID

text.name: Message Text

default.name: Message Sent
default.description: Emitted when the message has been successfully sent.

channel.description: ID of a Slack channel (e.g., C0123ABC), private group (G0123ABC), or direct message (D0123ABC).

message.description: The complete message object as returned by Slack's chat.postMessage API. Contains details about the message that was posted.

app_id.description: ID of a Slack App (e.g., A0123ABC).

blocks.description: An array of Slack Block Kit layout blocks. Present if the message was composed using Block Kit or if Slack converted the text to a rich_text block. See Slack documentation for block structures.

items.description: A Slack Block Kit layout block object. Its structure is defined by Slack. For detailed structure, refer to: https://api.slack.com/reference/block-kit/blocks

bot_id.description: ID of a bot user (e.g., B0123ABC).

bot_profile.description: Profile information for the bot user that posted the message.

app_id.description: The App ID associated with this bot (same as the outer app_id if present).

deleted.description: Indicates if the bot user is deleted.

icons.description: URLs for the bot's avatar images.

id.description: Bot ID (same as the outer bot_id if present).

team_id.description: The Team ID (workspace ID) this bot belongs to (same as the outer team if present).

updated.description: Timestamp (Unix epoch) of the last profile update.

parent_user_id.description: Optional. The user ID of the author of the parent message, if this message is a reply in a thread.

subtype.description: Optional. Indicates a subtype of message, e.g., 'bot_message'. For messages sent by this block, it's often 'bot_message'.

team.description: ID of a Slack workspace (team) (e.g., T0123ABC).

text.description: The textual content of the message. Markdown is supported by default in many contexts.

thread_ts.description: Optional. The timestamp of the parent message, if this message is part of a thread. If this message starts a new thread by replying to an existing message, this field will be present. If it's a brand new message not in a thread, this field is usually absent unless it becomes the parent of a new thread, in which case `thread_ts` would equal `ts`.

ts.description: Timestamp of the message. This value is effectively the ID of the message in Slack's API and is used to reference it in other operations (e.g., updating, deleting, threading).

type.description: The type of the object, always 'message'.

user.description: The user ID of the sender. For messages sent by a bot token, this is the bot's user ID.

ts.description: Timestamp of the message. This value is effectively the ID of the message in Slack's API and is used to reference it in other operations (e.g., updating, deleting, threading).

schema.name: Remove Reaction
schema.description: Removes a reaction (emoji) from a specific message in a Slack channel.

default.name: Remove
default.description: Trigger removing a reaction from the specified message.

channelId.name: Channel ID
channelId.description: ID of the channel (e.g., C0123ABC) containing the message.

name.name: Reaction Name
name.description: The emoji name to remove as a reaction (without colons, e.g., 'thumbsup', 'heart').

ts.name: Message Timestamp
ts.description: The timestamp (ts) of the message to remove a reaction from.

default.name: Reaction Removed
default.description: Emitted when the reaction has been successfully removed.

channel.description: ID of a Slack channel (e.g., C0123ABC), private group (G0123ABC), or direct message (D0123ABC).

reaction.description: The emoji name that was removed as a reaction.

ts.description: Timestamp of the message. This value is effectively the ID of the message in Slack's API and is used to reference it in other operations (e.g., updating, deleting, threading).

schema.name: Get Reactions
schema.description: Gets all reactions for a specific message in a Slack channel.

default.name: Get
default.description: Trigger getting reactions for the specified message.

channelId.name: Channel ID
channelId.description: ID of the channel (e.g., C0123ABC) containing the message.

full.name: Full Details
full.description: If true, returns full reaction details including user lists. If false, returns only reaction counts.

ts.name: Message Timestamp
ts.description: The timestamp (ts) of the message to get reactions for.

default.name: Reactions Retrieved
default.description: Emitted when reactions have been successfully retrieved.

channel.description: ID of a Slack channel (e.g., C0123ABC), private group (G0123ABC), or direct message (D0123ABC).

message.description: The message object with its reactions.

reactions.description: Array of reaction objects on this message.

count.description: Number of users who reacted with this emoji.

users.description: Array of user IDs who reacted (if full=true).

ts.description: Timestamp of the message. This value is effectively the ID of the message in Slack's API and is used to reference it in other operations (e.g., updating, deleting, threading).

type.description: Type of the item (typically 'message').

schema.name: Send Message With Interactions
schema.description: Sends a message with Block Kit blocks to a Slack channel and listens for user interactions (button clicks, menu selections, etc.). Has two outputs: one when the message is sent, and one for each interaction.

default.name: Send
default.description: Trigger sending the interactive message.

blocks.name: Message Blocks
blocks.description: The Slack Block Kit blocks to include in the message, as a JSON array. May contain interactive elements like buttons, select menus, etc.

items.description: A Slack Block Kit block object.

channelId.name: Channel or User ID
channelId.description: ID of the channel (e.g., C0123ABC), DM (D0123ABC), or user (U0123ABC) to send the message to.

text.name: Fallback Text
text.description: Fallback text to display in notifications and for accessibility. Should summarize the content of your blocks.

threadTs.name: Thread Timestamp
threadTs.description: If replying to a message, provide the 'ts' (timestamp) of the parent message.

interaction.name: Interaction Received
interaction.description: Emitted when a user interacts with the message (clicks button, selects from menu, etc.).

type.description: Slack interaction payload containing details about the user action.

actions.description: Array of actions that were triggered.

items.description: Details about the specific action (button click, menu selection, etc.).

action_id.description: The action_id of the element that was triggered.

block_id.description: The block_id of the block containing the triggered element.

selected_date.description: The selected date (for datepicker, format: YYYY-MM-DD).

selected_option.description: The selected option (for single select menus).

selected_time.description: The selected time (for timepicker, format: HH:MM).

text.description: Text object for elements like buttons.

type.description: The type of action (e.g., 'button', 'static_select', 'users_select', 'conversations_select', 'channels_select', 'external_select', 'overflow', 'datepicker', 'timepicker', 'radio_buttons', 'checkboxes').

value.description: The value of the action (for buttons and overflow menus).

channel.description: Information about the channel where the interaction occurred.

id.description: ID of a Slack channel (e.g., C0123ABC), private group (G0123ABC), or direct message (D0123ABC).

message_ts.description: Timestamp of the message. This value is effectively the ID of the message in Slack's API and is used to reference it in other operations (e.g., updating, deleting, threading).

type.description: Container type (usually 'message').

message.description: The message that contains the interactive element.

response_url.description: URL that can be used to respond to the interaction.

id.description: ID of a Slack workspace (team) (e.g., T0123ABC).

trigger_id.description: A temporary token to open modals or other interactive elements.

type.description: The type of interaction (e.g., 'block_actions', 'interactive_message', 'view_submission').

user.description: Information about the user who performed the interaction.

id.description: ID of a Slack user (e.g., U0123ABC).

team_id.description: ID of a Slack workspace (team) (e.g., T0123ABC).

sent.name: Message Sent
sent.description: Emitted when the interactive message has been successfully sent.

channel.description: ID of a Slack channel (e.g., C0123ABC), private group (G0123ABC), or direct message (D0123ABC).

message.description: The complete message object as returned by Slack's chat.postMessage API.

app_id.description: ID of a Slack App (e.g., A0123ABC).

blocks.description: An array of Slack Block Kit layout blocks. Present if the message was composed using Block Kit or if Slack converted the text to a rich_text block. See Slack documentation for block structures.

items.description: A Slack Block Kit layout block object. Its structure is defined by Slack. For detailed structure, refer to: https://api.slack.com/reference/block-kit/blocks

bot_id.description: ID of a bot user (e.g., B0123ABC).

bot_profile.description: Profile information for the bot user that posted the message.

app_id.description: The App ID associated with this bot (same as the outer app_id if present).

deleted.description: Indicates if the bot user is deleted.

icons.description: URLs for the bot's avatar images.

id.description: Bot ID (same as the outer bot_id if present).

team_id.description: The Team ID (workspace ID) this bot belongs to (same as the outer team if present).

updated.description: Timestamp (Unix epoch) of the last profile update.

parent_user_id.description: Optional. The user ID of the author of the parent message, if this message is a reply in a thread.

subtype.description: Optional. Indicates a subtype of message, e.g., 'bot_message'.

team.description: ID of a Slack workspace (team) (e.g., T0123ABC).

text.description: The textual content of the message. Markdown is supported by default in many contexts.

thread_ts.description: Optional. The timestamp of the parent message, if this message is part of a thread. If this message starts a new thread by replying to an existing message, this field will be present. If it's a brand new message not in a thread, this field is usually absent unless it becomes the parent of a new thread, in which case `thread_ts` would equal `ts`.

ts.description: Timestamp of the message. This value is effectively the ID of the message in Slack's API and is used to reference it in other operations (e.g., updating, deleting, threading).

type.description: The type of the object, always 'message'.

user.description: The user ID of the sender. For messages sent by a bot token, this is the bot's user ID.

ts.description: Timestamp of the message. This value is effectively the ID of the message in Slack's API and is used to reference it in other operations (e.g., updating, deleting, threading).

nameComponent.name: Button Click Modal
nameComponent.description: This entity opens a modal view that displays information about which button was clicked and provides an OK button for user confirmation.

schema.name: Open View With Interactions
schema.description: Opens a modal view with Block Kit blocks and listens for user interactions (form submissions, view closed events).

default.name: Open
default.description: Trigger opening the interactive view.

blocks.name: Blocks
blocks.description: Array of Block Kit blocks to display in the modal.

callbackId.name: Callback ID
callbackId.description: An identifier you can use to identify this particular view.

clearOnClose.name: Clear on Close
clearOnClose.description: When true, clicking the close button will clear all views in the modal stack.

externalId.name: External ID
externalId.description: A unique external ID for the view (max 255 characters).

notifyOnClose.name: Notify on Close
notifyOnClose.description: When true, Slack will send a view_closed event when the modal is closed.

privateMetadata.name: Private Metadata
privateMetadata.description: Private data that will be passed to interaction payloads (max 3000 characters).

title.name: Title
title.description: The title text of the modal (max 24 characters).

triggerId.name: Trigger ID
triggerId.description: The trigger_id received from a Slack interaction (button click, slash command, etc.). Required to open a modal.

interaction.name: View Interaction
interaction.description: Emitted when a user interacts with the view (submits form, closes modal, etc.).

type.description: Slack view interaction payload containing details about the user action.

api_app_id.description: The app ID of the app that opened the view.

response_urls.description: Array of response URLs that can be used to send messages.

id.description: ID of a Slack workspace (team) (e.g., T0123ABC).

token.description: A verification token (deprecated, use signing secret instead).

trigger_id.description: A temporary token that can be used to open another modal.

type.description: The type of view interaction.

user.description: Information about the user who performed the interaction.

id.description: ID of a Slack user (e.g., U0123ABC).

team_id.description: ID of a Slack workspace (team) (e.g., T0123ABC).

view.description: The view object at the time of interaction.

opened.name: View Opened
opened.description: Emitted when the modal view has been successfully opened.

view.description: The opened view object as returned by Slack.

app_id.description: The app ID that opened the view.

blocks.description: The blocks that were rendered in the view.

bot_id.description: The bot ID associated with the app.

callback_id.description: The callback ID if one was provided.

clear_on_close.description: Whether the view stack clears on close.

external_id.description: The external ID if one was provided.

hash.description: A unique value for this view state.

id.description: The unique ID of the view.

private_metadata.description: The private metadata that was included.

root_view_id.description: The root view ID if this is part of a view stack.

state.description: The current state of the view's interactive components.

values.description: Map of block IDs to their current values.

team_id.description: ID of a Slack workspace (team) (e.g., T0123ABC).

type.description: The type of view.

nameComponent.name: View Submission Confirmation
nameComponent.description: This entity sends an ephemeral confirmation message to the user who submitted a modal view, confirming their action on a test channel.

schema.name: Send Ephemeral Message Blocks
schema.description: Sends a message with Block Kit blocks to a Slack channel that is only visible to a specific user.

default.name: Send
default.description: Trigger sending the ephemeral message.

blocks.name: Message Blocks
blocks.description: JSON array of Slack Block Kit blocks for the message content.

channelId.name: Channel ID
channelId.description: ID of the channel (e.g., C0123ABC) to send the message to.

text.name: Fallback Text
text.description: Plain text fallback for the message, used in notifications and when blocks cannot be displayed.

userId.name: User ID
userId.description: ID of the user (e.g., U0123ABC) who should see the ephemeral message.

default.name: Message Sent
default.description: Emitted when the ephemeral message has been successfully sent.

channel.description: ID of a Slack channel (e.g., C0123ABC), private group (G0123ABC), or direct message (D0123ABC).

message_ts.description: Timestamp of the ephemeral message that was sent.

user.description: ID of a Slack user (e.g., U0123ABC).

blocks.code: [{"type": "section", "text": {"type": "mrkdwn", "text": ":white_check_mark: *View Submitted Successfully*\n\nYour modal view has been submitted and processed. Thank you for your input!"}}]

text.code: "View submitted successfully! Your action has been confirmed."

nameComponent.name: View Submission Confirmation DM
nameComponent.description: This entity sends a direct message confirmation to the user after they submit a view/modal, letting them know their submission was received.

schema.name: Send Text Message
schema.description: Sends a simple markdown-formatted text message to a Slack channel or user. Can optionally be a thread reply.

default.name: Send
default.description: Trigger sending the message.

channelId.name: Channel or User ID
channelId.description: ID of the channel (e.g., C0123ABC), DM (D0123ABC), or user (U0123ABC) to send the message to.

text.name: Message Text
text.description: The text of the message. Markdown is supported by default.

threadTs.name: Thread Timestamp
threadTs.description: If replying to a message, provide the 'ts' (timestamp) of the parent message.

default.name: Message Sent
default.description: Emitted when the message has been successfully sent.

channel.description: ID of a Slack channel (e.g., C0123ABC), private group (G0123ABC), or direct message (D0123ABC).

message.description: The complete message object as returned by Slack's chat.postMessage API. Contains details about the message that was posted.

app_id.description: ID of a Slack App (e.g., A0123ABC).

blocks.description: An array of Slack Block Kit layout blocks. Present if the message was composed using Block Kit or if Slack converted the text to a rich_text block. See Slack documentation for block structures.

items.description: A Slack Block Kit layout block object. Its structure is defined by Slack. For detailed structure, refer to: https://api.slack.com/reference/block-kit/blocks

bot_id.description: ID of a bot user (e.g., B0123ABC).

bot_profile.description: Profile information for the bot user that posted the message.

app_id.description: The App ID associated with this bot (same as the outer app_id if present).

deleted.description: Indicates if the bot user is deleted.

icons.description: URLs for the bot's avatar images.

id.description: Bot ID (same as the outer bot_id if present).

team_id.description: The Team ID (workspace ID) this bot belongs to (same as the outer team if present).

updated.description: Timestamp (Unix epoch) of the last profile update.

parent_user_id.description: Optional. The user ID of the author of the parent message, if this message is a reply in a thread.

subtype.description: Optional. Indicates a subtype of message, e.g., 'bot_message'. For messages sent by this block, it's often 'bot_message'.

team.description: ID of a Slack workspace (team) (e.g., T0123ABC).

text.description: The textual content of the message. Markdown is supported by default in many contexts.

thread_ts.description: Optional. The timestamp of the parent message, if this message is part of a thread. If this message starts a new thread by replying to an existing message, this field will be present. If it's a brand new message not in a thread, this field is usually absent unless it becomes the parent of a new thread, in which case `thread_ts` would equal `ts`.

ts.description: Timestamp of the message. This value is effectively the ID of the message in Slack's API and is used to reference it in other operations (e.g., updating, deleting, threading).

type.description: The type of the object, always 'message'.

user.description: The user ID of the sender. For messages sent by a bot token, this is the bot's user ID.

ts.description: Timestamp of the message. This value is effectively the ID of the message in Slack's API and is used to reference it in other operations (e.g., updating, deleting, threading).

text.code: "Thanks for your submission! We've received your information and will process it shortly."

nameComponent.name: Update Echo Message
nameComponent.description: This entity updates a previously sent Slack message by appending '(updated after sleep)' to its original content.

schema.name: Update Message Blocks
schema.description: Updates an existing Slack message with new Block Kit blocks.

default.name: Update
default.description: Trigger updating the message with new blocks.

blocks.name: New Message Blocks
blocks.description: The new Slack Block Kit blocks to replace the message content, as a JSON array.

items.description: A Slack Block Kit block object.

channelId.name: Channel ID
channelId.description: ID of the channel (e.g., C0123ABC) containing the message to update.

text.name: Fallback Text
text.description: Fallback text to display in notifications and for accessibility. Should summarize the content of your blocks.

ts.name: Message Timestamp
ts.description: Timestamp (ts) of the message to update.

default.name: Message Updated
default.description: Emitted when the message has been successfully updated.

blocks.description: An array of Slack Block Kit layout blocks. Present if the message was composed using Block Kit or if Slack converted the text to a rich_text block. See Slack documentation for block structures.

items.description: A Slack Block Kit layout block object. Its structure is defined by Slack. For detailed structure, refer to: https://api.slack.com/reference/block-kit/blocks

channel.description: ID of a Slack channel (e.g., C0123ABC), private group (G0123ABC), or direct message (D0123ABC).

text.description: The text content of the updated message.

ts.description: Timestamp of the message. This value is effectively the ID of the message in Slack's API and is used to reference it in other operations (e.g., updating, deleting, threading).

schema.name: Delete Message
schema.description: Deletes a message from a Slack channel using its channel ID and timestamp.

default.name: Delete
default.description: Trigger deletion of the specified message.

channelId.name: Channel ID
channelId.description: ID of the channel (e.g., C0123ABC) where the message is located.

ts.name: Message Timestamp
ts.description: The timestamp (ts) of the message to delete.

default.name: Message Deleted
default.description: Emitted when the message has been successfully deleted.

channel.description: ID of a Slack channel (e.g., C0123ABC), private group (G0123ABC), or direct message (D0123ABC).

ts.description: Timestamp of the message. This value is effectively the ID of the message in Slack's API and is used to reference it in other operations (e.g., updating, deleting, threading).
